table.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: The logical name of the element

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: Information about the use of the element

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: Minimum and Maximum # of times the element can appear in the instance

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px; width: 100px

a.title: Reference to the type of the element

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck1.png)

a.title: Model contains elements needed for registering an individual medication administration. It is derived from the full dosage regimen model in order to keep the consistency between the shared elements.

description.value: Model contains elements needed for registering an individual medication administration. It is derived from the full dosage regimen model in order to keep the consistency between the shared elements.

short.value: Administered dosage model

definition.value: Model contains elements needed for registering an individual medication administration. It is derived from the full dosage regimen model in order to keep the consistency between the shared elements.

short.value: Full dosage information as human-readable text covering all dosage steps. Generating the text follows local rules and should include all locally implemented dosage data even when such elements are not present in this model.

definition.value: Full dosage information as human-readable text covering all dosage steps. Generating the text follows local rules and should include all locally implemented dosage data even when such elements are not present in this model.

short.value: Details of single dosage scheme step

definition.value: Details of single dosage scheme step

short.value: Order of the dosage instruction, in case one treatment consists of several dosage steps. When two schemes share the same sequence number, they are meant to be running in parallel.

definition.value: Order of the dosage instruction, in case one treatment consists of several dosage steps. When two schemes share the same sequence number, they are meant to be running in parallel.

short.value: Patient oriented instructions as free text for this dosage step

definition.value: Patient oriented instructions as free text for this dosage step

short.value: Amount of medication administered per one dose (= one timing)

definition.value: Amount of medication administered per one dose (= one timing)

short.value: Amount of medication per one dose. (1 tablet, 2-3 tablets, 20ml)

definition.value: Amount of medication per one dose. (1 tablet, 2-3 tablets, 20ml)

description.value: UCUM (units of measurement), EDQM Standard Terms (units of presentation)

short.value: Amount of medication per time period (e.g. 100mg per 1 hour). When rate is provided per 1 time unit, Quantity data type can be used with a suitable unit (e.g. mg/h, ug/min).

definition.value: Amount of medication per time period (e.g. 100mg per 1 hour). When rate is provided per 1 time unit, Quantity data type can be used with a suitable unit (e.g. mg/h, ug/min).

description.value: UCUM (units of measurement), EDQM Standard Terms (units of presentation)

short.value: Repetition of the administration.

definition.value: Repetition of the administration.

short.value: Time bounds for the treatment (current dosage scheme). Only one of the following can exist.

definition.value: Time bounds for the treatment (current dosage scheme). Only one of the following can exist.

short.value: Number of time units, e.g 10 days

definition.value: Number of time units, e.g 10 days

short.value: Start and end date, 05.08.2023 - 10.08.2023

definition.value: Start and end date, 05.08.2023 - 10.08.2023

short.value: Duration of administration (e.g '5 minutes', '1 hour')

definition.value: Duration of administration (e.g '5 minutes', '1 hour')

short.value: Frequency of intake/administration (e.g 'three times a day')

definition.value: Frequency of intake/administration (e.g 'three times a day')

short.value: Number of times per period (e.g '3 times')

definition.value: Number of times per period (e.g '3 times')

short.value: Duration to which the frequency applies (e.g '... / 1 day')

definition.value: Duration to which the frequency applies (e.g '... / 1 day')

short.value: The day of the week of administration, e.g Mon, Tue, etc

definition.value: The day of the week of administration, e.g Mon, Tue, etc

short.value: Exact time of day of administration (e.g '10:00')

definition.value: Exact time of day of administration (e.g '10:00')

short.value: Time period or event when the administration should happen ('before meal', 'immediately', 'morning')

definition.value: Time period or event when the administration should happen ('before meal', 'immediately', 'morning')

short.value: Take as needed

definition.value: Take as needed

short.value: Body site of administration

definition.value: Body site of administration

short.value: Route of administration

definition.value: Route of administration

short.value: Administered dosage model

definition.value: Model contains elements needed for registering an individual medication administration. It is derived from the full dosage regimen model in order to keep the consistency between the shared elements.
